the former name for Istanbul, a city that was the capital of Turkey until 1923: The defending forces fled the city by boat to Constantinople. The Eastern Christian empire was known as Byzantium and based in Constantinople.
More examplesFewer examplesThe relics disappeared from Constantinople, today's Istanbul. The two tall columns were brought from Constantinople in the 12th century.First Council of Constantinople in 381 ruled that the archbishop of that city had equal rights with the Bishop of Rome.
